properties.name: Agaton Road Footbridge
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamPedestrian bridge over The Parkway which links Agaton Road with Ernesettle Lane

properties.name: Albert Road Tunnel Entrance
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamThe \'city\' end of the Albert Road tunnel. It is difficult to get a decent photo of this end of the tunnel.

properties.name: Albert Road Tunnel Entrance
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamA fairly short tunnel under Albert Road. This tunnel is unique in that it passes over another tunnel which is only a few feet below at one point. It used to carry another railway but is now disused. More information to follow!

properties.name: Alma Road Footbridge
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamThe bridge that isnt there anymore!

properties.name: Ashford Hill
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamVery narrow small road bridge carrying main line over Asford Hill. Steep road way give little clearance for road vehicles on what can be a busy shortcut for traffic

properties.name: Beaumaris Road footbridge
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamPedestrian bridge linking Culver Way to Beaumaris Road

properties.name: Billacombe Road Bridge
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamSmall meteal railway bridge which used to carry the branch line over this small lane as access to the quarry workings.

properties.name: Bircham Road
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamSeems to be a lane under The Parkway which leads up into some large houses, possibly a Farm? Nothing detailed on Google Maps so may be part of the MOD site?

properties.name: Boscawen Place
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamVery small bridge takes the main line over Boscawen Place. I am sure its only pedestrians under the bridge now but I may be wrong!

properties.name: Brandon Road Footpath
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamI am sure that the footpath linking Brandon Road and Lipson Vale goes under the main line here

properties.name: CDS Bridge
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamTucked in behind CDS this little railway bridge now serves as access to the industrial estate in the old quarry workings.

properties.name: Coombe Road Bridge
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamNice little rail bridge between Saltash Station and Coombe Valley Viaduct. Limited height and built at an odd angle. Nice little bridge

properties.name: Cot Hill
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamActually two seperate bridges side by side, one for each lane carrying Cot Hill over the main line. This bridge would give good views over the old railway yard but there is no footpath on the left lane bridge

properties.name: Crabtree Creek
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamNo idea if the name is correct but there is a small bridge taking the main line over a small stream into the River Plym.

properties.name: Crownhill Road Bridge
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamTakes the main Crownhill Road over the Parkway. Links two roundabouts on either side of The Parkway to which provide access to The Parkway.

properties.name: Culver Way Footbridge
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamPedestrian bridge over the Parkway linking Culver Way and Reddington Road.

properties.name: De La Hay Avenue
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamA lovely little bridge which carries the main line over the avenue. It is very narrow and limited headroom so is one way traffic only.

properties.name: Devonport Road bridge
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamCarries the main road through Stoke Village across the main line

properties.name: Devonport Station Pedestrian bridge
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamYou get the feeling this fine metal footbridge was once a lot grander than it is now. Links the two platforms

properties.name: Donington Drive Footbridge
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamLong pedestrian bridge over the Parkway linking Donnington Drive and Dale Avenue

properties.name: Eggbuckland Road Bridge
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamLarge curved road bridge at the bottom of Eggbuckland Road. The road used to go the the bottom of the valley, but the new bridge was built first and then the new parkway was built under it.

properties.name: Embankment Road Railway bridge
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamThe main road into Plymouth runs over the main line into Plymouth. This is a great vantage point for railway photography.

properties.name: Ferry Road Station Bridge
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamThis bridge carries Wolsley Road over the main line to Penzance. The Ferry Road Station is down to the right hand side of the bridge.

properties.name: Forder Valley Roundabout
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamLarge roundabout provides two bridges over the Parkway.

properties.name: Forder Valley Roundabout
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamThe second bridge over the Parkway, part of the main roundabout

properties.name: Garfield terrace
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamThis is a most unusual bridge as it joins the main line at an odd angle right next to The Elms road bridge. The line under this bridge is long gone. The line itself cam in top left and out bottom right of the marker. It originally joined what I am sure was a large goods yard. This yard has now been totally cleared and is now just a large building site. The buildings shown on the Google Map are all now gone. I am still trying to find out more about this whole area.

properties.name: Haddington Road
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamTakes Haddington Road over the main line

properties.name: Havelock Terrace
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamRoad bridge over the main line. Pedestrain access to the station is to the left, but only on one side of the platform.

properties.name: Honicknowle Lane bridge
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamRoad bridge carries Honicknowle Lane over The Parkway

properties.name: Keyham Station
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamA small pedestrian bridge which links both platforms of Keyham Station. It also provides a link to nearby Admiralty Street

properties.name: Kings Street Footbridge
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamLinking the Toys R Us complex with the Western Approach footbridge

properties.name: Laira railway bridge
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamA long since disused metal railway bridge which ised to carry the Yealmpton branch line.

properties.name: Linketty Lane Footbridge
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamSmall pedestrian bridge over the main line

properties.name: Lipson Vale
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamLarge railway bridge carrying main line over Lipson Vale.

properties.name: Little Dock Lane footbridge
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamLarge pedestrian bridge over the Parkway which links Little Dock Lane with a network of paths through the woods ontowards Camels Head

properties.name: Manadon Flyover
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamWonderful elegant flyover which takes traffic straight over the top of the Parkway and the Manadon Roundabout.

properties.name: Manadon Footbridge
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamNice little footbridge that is actually suspended underneath the main flyover which takes all pedestrians through this busy junction

properties.name: Manadon Roundabout Northbound
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamNorthbound bridge, over Parkway, part of the Manadon Roundabout Junction.

properties.name: Manadon Roundabout Southbound
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamSouthbound bridge, over Parkway, part of the Manadon Roundabout Junction.

properties.name: Marsh Mills Flyover
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamNice complex flyover taking the A38 Parkway over the very busy Marsh Mills Roundabout, the River Plym and the main railway line. The two slip roads onto the roundabout were built alongside the original road and then moved into position over the course of a weekend. Plenty more information to follow on this bridge when i get the chance

properties.name: Marsh Mills Flyover Footpath.
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamA foot pah runs along side the Marsh Mills Flyover and over the main line and along side the River Plym. Another great vantage point for railway photography

properties.name: Marsh Mills Railway Bridge
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamOld style looking bridge carries main line over the River Plym.

properties.name: Molesworth Road bridge
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamCarries Molesworth Road across the main line.

properties.name: Mullet Road
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamSmall bridge carries main line over the road entrance to the Laira Railway Depot.

properties.name: Mutley Tunnel East Entrance
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamMain line goes under Mutley Plain on its way into Plymouth Station.

properties.name: Mutley Tunnel Weset Entrance
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamThe main line goes beneath the public car park built over the entrance to Mutley Tunnel

properties.name: Normandy Hill Bridge
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamSmall road bridge over the main line into Cornwall. This is on a quite steep hill.

properties.name: North Road Station Bridge
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamCarries the main line out of Plymouth Station across the busy Alma Road.

properties.name: Paisley Street Bridge
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamCarries Paisley Street over the main line.

properties.name: Parkstone Lane
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamIt appears that the main line goes over Parkstone Lane at this point

properties.name: Plymbridge Road Bridge
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamTwo bridges side by side. A narrow road bridge tales Plymbridge Road over the main line. There is also a small pedestrian bridge alongside as the road bridge is too narrow for a footpath

properties.name: Plymouth Pavillions Footbridge
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamPedestrian footway over Union Street linking Toyas R Us Car Park with Plymouth Pavillions. Roughly where the old Union Street Railway bridge used to cross the road

properties.name: Plymouth Road Bridge
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamTakes the main Plymouth Road over the mainline

properties.name: Royal Albert Bridge
properties.description: Posted by Didbygraham The most famous of all Plymouth\'s bridges. Designed and built by IK Brunel. Construction started in 1853 and the grand openingwas on the 2nd May 1859. Amazingly this magnificent bridge only cost £225,000 to build!

properties.name: Royal Navy Avenue Road Bridge
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamSmall road bridge over the main line

properties.name: Saltash Passage MOD Base car Park Bridge
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamSmall rail bridge carries the Gunnislake Branch line over a narrow road leading into the MOD Base car park. This bridge is gated for security.

properties.name: Saltash Road Bridge
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamCarries Saltash Road over the main line. From this bridge you can see the branch line into HMS Drake and on the other side you can look down into Keyham Station

properties.name: Shortcut
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamI believe that there is a footpath here which goes under the main line.

properties.name: St Budeaux Main line crossing point
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamThis small bridge carries the single track main Penzance line over the Gunnislake branch line.

properties.name: St Levans Road Viaduct
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamThis is the one remaining viaduct over the St Levan Valley. Its not as big or impressive as the old one which was just down the road (to the right) but its still a big one. Has fantastic views over the dockyard for any train passengers

properties.name: St Peters Bridge
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamPedestrian bridge over the Parkway which links Trevone Gardens and St Peters Road

properties.name: Stamps bridge
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamStamps Bridge used to carry the Turnchapel branch line across what is now a busy road junction with two roundabouts. There is a small brick wall with a metal plaque - all that remains of a substantial bridge.

properties.name: Station Road Bridge
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamSmall bridge carrying main line over Station Road. This is used as a pedestrian entrance to the Goschen Centre which is now a major campus of Plymouth College of Further Education.

properties.name: Stream by Linketty Lane
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamSmall bridge carries main line over a small stream

properties.name: Strode Road
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamMain line over Strode Road. This is a major industrial area of Plymouth

properties.name: Stuart Road Viaduct
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamA wonderful viaduct carrying the main line over Stuar Road and Victoria Park. There used to be another bridge which joined onto this one carrying the main line into Millbay Station. This will be covered later.

properties.name: Sutherland Road Bridge
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamA very popular bridge to take photographs from as it looks down onto Plymouth Station

properties.name: Tamar Bridge
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamThe Bridge has its own web site which provides a fair bit of information along with some nice photographs with its webcams. Another source of nice photos is the Westcountry Views page The extension work carried out in 2001-2002 was groundbreaking and recieved world wide attention. It was also a finalist in the Prime Ministers Award for Better Public Buildings. There is more information about the bridge and the widening project here. Another award.

properties.name: The Elms
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamNice wide road bridge across the main line. I will come back to this bridge later as its a little bit more interesting than some of the others!

properties.name: Victoria Road Station
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamRight next to Ferry Road bridge there is another fine bridge this time taking the main Wolsley Road over the Gunnislake Branch Line and the entrance to Victoria Road Station. The station itself is very run down and a shadow of its former self. It used to be double track here.

properties.name: Western Approach Footbridge
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamLinking the Toys R Us complex with Frankfort Gate over Western Approach

properties.name: Weston Mill Drive
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamSmall bridge taking The Parkway over Weston Mill Drive which provides a direct route through to Camels Head

properties.name: Weston Mill Viaduct
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamKnown locally as Shakey Bridge. It carries the main line across Camels Head Creek. Below is all part of the main Plymouth Naval Base mostly on reclaimed land. There used to be a public footpath along the bridge which saved a very long walk. Now sadly closed on safety grounds.

properties.name: Wingfield Way
properties.description: Posted by DidbygrahamAnother little road bridge over the main line. There were two bridges right next to each other. But more on that later!
